from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score,mean_squared_error
DTRegModel= DecisionTreeRegressor()
DTRegModel.fit(X_train, Y_train)
y_pdt= DTRegModel.predict(X_test)
DTRegModel

MSE= mean_squared_error(Y_test, y_pdt)
RMSE= np.sqrt(MSE)
RMSE

from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix 
from sklearn.metrics import classification_report
from sklearn.metrics import plot_confusion_matrix
plot_confusion_matrix(DT, X_test, Y_test, cmap=plt.cm.Blues, display_labels = ["Real", "Not Real"])

Making the tree shorter by
1.Entropy
2.Gini
3.max depth

DT = DecisionTreeClassifier(criterion='entropy')
DT.fit(X_train,Y_train)
pdt = DT.predict(X_test)
print('Criterion=entropy', accuracy_score(Y_test, pdt))

maxdepth=[]
entropy=[]
for i in range(1 ,20):
    DT = DecisionTreeClassifier(criterion='entropy', max_depth=i)
    DT.fit(X_train,Y_train)
    pdt = DT.predict(X_test)
    entropy.append(accuracy_score(Y_test, pdt))
    maxdepth.append(i)
entropy #this shows the different values of accuracy for i (1,20)
plot_confusion_matrix(DT, X_test, Y_test, cmap=plt.cm.Blues, display_labels = ["Real", "Not Real"])

from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score,mean_squared_error
DTRegModel= DecisionTreeRegressor()
DTRegModel.fit(X_train, Y_train)
y_pdt= DTRegModel.predict(X_test)

MSE= mean_squared_error(Y_test, y_pdt)
RMSE= np.sqrt(MSE)
RMSE

maxdepth=[]
gini=[]
for i in range(1 ,20):
    DT = DecisionTreeClassifier(criterion='gini', max_depth=i)
    DT.fit(X_train,Y_train)
    pdt = DT.predict(X_test)
    gini.append(accuracy_score(Y_test, pdt))
    maxdepth.append(i)
gini #this shows the different values of accuracy for i (1,20)
plot_confusion_matrix(DT, X_test, Y_test, cmap=plt.cm.Blues, display_labels = ["Real", "Not Real"])
Comparing the value of accuracy obtained by the above two methods, we plot a graph.

dtree = DecisionTreeClassifier(criterion='entropy', max_depth=7)
dtree.fit(X_train, Y_train)
pred = dtree.predict(X_test)
accuracy_score(Y_test, pred)

from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score,mean_squared_error
DTRegModel= DecisionTreeRegressor()
DTRegModel.fit(X_train, Y_train)
y_pdt= DTRegModel.predict(X_test)

MSE= mean_squared_error(Y_test, y_pdt)
RMSE= np.sqrt(MSE)
RMSE
